meanings.definition: A person who incepts or begins something.
meanings.sent1: The inceptors of the project were excited to see it come to life.
meanings.sent2: The team of inceptors brainstormed ideas for the new campaign.
meanings.sent3: The inceptors shared a laugh as they discussed their innovative ideas.
meanings.sent4: She was the inceptor of the book club, sparking a love for reading in others.
meanings.sent5: The inceptors' passion and dedication inspired those around them.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that initiates a process.
meanings.sent1: The inceptors of the alarm system were carefully installed in the building.
meanings.sent2: Pressing the button on the remote control acted as the inceptors for the toy car.
meanings.sent3: The inceptors beeped loudly, signaling the start of the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The key served as the inceptor, unlocking the mysteries of the old chest.
meanings.sent5: The inceptors hummed softly, ready to set the plan in motion.

meanings.definition: The act of incepting or starting something.
meanings.sent1: The inceptors of change faced challenges but remained determined.
meanings.sent2: In the world of business, the inceptors of new trends often face risks.
meanings.sent3: The inceptors of the race stumbled at the starting line, causing a humorous delay.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the inceptor of joy, spreading positivity to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The inceptors of the movement stood united, ready to make a difference.
